resources.string: I\'m an IT student currently focused on Android development. Previously I have endeavored into parallel processing using CUDA, 3D modeling for real time use and released an app on Google Play. I have been creating mobile games and interactive media in Unity. Right now I would like to continue developing for Android. I\'m a team player and committed to the task I’m given. I\'m looking for a company with friendly but driven team with clear strategy for the developed product.
Thesis: Terrain generation on the GPU Implementation and comparison of algorithms generating random height maps resembling real terrain using CPU and GPU variants.
Currently studying in field Service Science, Management, and Engineering.
iMax Games, São Carlos - Brazil,\nOct 2015 - May 2016
3D modelling of ingame assets, level design, creation and animation of 3D assets for interactive book, programing modules for inhouse development tool Unify.
Java / Android, C / Cuda, Git, Photoshop, ZBrush, Cinema4D, Unity

I \'ve developed own app for web api data retrieval. Used service class for repeated querying and multiple fragments for showing data status. The app is published on Google Play and had over 200 downloads and about quarter of that were active users. Later however the data changed and the info which it provided was not very beneficial anymore, so I have stopped it\'s development. Since I have created this app from scratch all by myself, it has proven to be a very hard and tedious task, but on the other hand it gave me a lot of experience.\n\n https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=sk.tomus.alertside

Completed course about Heterogeneous Parallel Programming and received statement of accomplishment with distinction in 2013\nhttp://bit.ly/1DMVmJa\n . Done bachelor\'s thesis using Visual Studio with Nvidia Nsight about terrain generation algorithms. Here are some examples of Random Faults algorithm which is only viable if implemented on GPU:

Developed personal game project Tunel Smash. Single machine multiplayer game which mixes attributes of original DOS Tunneler game and Minecraft. GIT: https://github.com/7Tomus/Tunel-Smash.git\nI have also worked on a plugin module for Unify which rendered mathematical functions and provided huge customizability

Created 3D set of items for game Dota2. Process involved low-poly modelling, high-poly sculpting, UV-unwrapping, texturing, applying shader values, skinning and creation of marketing materials. Link: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=174186897
Preservation of environment\nWorkcamps by IJGD, SIW and NICE

Hann. Münden - Germany - 2006
Ameland - Holland - 2007
Gevelsberg - Germany - 2008
Shiiba - Japan - 2014
Basketball, Snowboarding, Running, Outdoor Workout, Hiking, Online Gaming, Tutoring in ISC MU Brno
